dialogues.text: Its thickness effects implantation. And today when I went for my ultrasound, mine measured eight point two millimeters. Ideally, you want anywhere from eight to ten on the day of the transfer, so I’m already there.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (detached) That’s great, honey. Richard stabs the needle into Rachel’s haunch. She barely flinches. He presses the plunger, then pulls it out.  112

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know all this stuff with Sadie is upsetting and I want to be sympathetic, but the transfer is in two days and my acupuncturist said I need to create a really warm welcoming non-negative environment so the embryo will attach. She told me to eat warm food. No salads. Soups and stews. And she told me to laugh, Richard. I’m supposed to laugh. But I’m not laughing. (starting to cry) If you were an embryo, would you want to attach to a negative, cold environment? No. You’d want it to be warm and funny and positive. Rachel is sobbing; Richard stays nearby, but seems very f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dordick is once again between Rachel’s legs as he transfe embryos. A different EAGLES SONG plays; he mouths the wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel holds the collar of her coat; Richard tries to fla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride in the back looking out opposite windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHOTO OF THE NEW EMBRYOS is stuck on the refrigerator with a magnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel emerges from a subway station and walks down a bus street toward Dordick’s office. INT. DORDICK’S OFFICE - DAY Rachel has her blood drawn. She grabs a lollipop, walks p the wall covered in birth announcements and exits, but instead of following, WE STAY BEHIND as the CAMERA pans t

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITING ROOM,
dialogues.text: filled with anxious women and painfully silent, except fo WIRE MOBILE tapping against the window.  113

dialogues.speaker: DORDICK, (PRE-LAP, ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Discontinue the progesterone, the estrogen patches, the Estrace as well as the supplements. INT. RACHEL AND RICHARD’S APARTMENT - DUSK As Dordick continues, the CAMERA moves through the seemin empty apartment --

dialogues.speaker: DORDICK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Barbara will call you early next week to schedule a meeting to talk about next steps. -- and finally arrives on Richard and Rachel who are seen SILHOUETTE. Richard mumbles something into the phone, the they hang up and just stand there, staring into space. Af a while, Richard wanders off.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: To walk the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: They lie in bed -- Richard on his back, eyes open; Rachel curled up, facing the wall. We hear a party going on in t apartment above them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m so sad. (no response) Richard?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don’t those people ever fucking stop partying? Richard stands up on the bed and BANGS the ceiling with a book. It works! The music is lowered.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I did. And I know that intellectually I’m supposed to... do something for you, right now -- comfort you or whatever, but I’m sorry. I can’t, right now. I just don’t have it in me.  114

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (very low, shaky) Okay. A long, painful silence.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You're going to hate me for saying this, you'll think it’s hideous sacrilege, but I’m actually sort of glad the cycle didn’t work because... at least now it’s over. Rachel turns to him, aghast. I know it’s a harsh, but that’s how I honestly feel. Relieved. I don’t think I even want to have a kid anymore. I just want my life back. I mean, look at us. We’re a mess. It’s like we’re not even in a relationship, let alone a marriage. I’m not your husband, I'm just some... guy who injects hormones into your ass every night. We don’t even have sex.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Wait, is that what this is about? Sex?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No. Yeah. Well, maybe. I don’t know. What d’you think? Do you think we’re ever going to have sex again?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Are you actually asking me that right now or are you being theoretical?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No. I’m not. I'm actually asking you -- do you think we will ever have sex again?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. I mean, yes. Of course, we will. At some point.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: At what point will that be, exactly?  115

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Why are you so fixated on this?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m not. I’m just pointing out that while we’ve been so obsessed with this... project we’ve had sex maybe one time in eleven months and you had to get trashed on a bottle rosé before you would even consider it. Jesus, Doctor Dordick is more intimate with your vagina than I am.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, my god. Do you want sex right now? Is that it? Before Richard can respond, Rachel opens a drawer and tak out a CANDLE clearly reserved for romance, then removes a VIBRATOR from a draw-string bag. Because we just had a failed IVF and I don’t know about you, but generally that makes me feel pretty shitty and dead and despondent and doesn’t put me in a particularly erotic frame of mind. But if you're dead set on it, I’m sure we can manage something. But I can’t guarantee that it’s going to be a hell of a lot of fun. She twists the bottom of the vibrator and it makes a loud buzzing sound. Hey, batteries still work. It’s our lucky day! She throws the vibrator onto the bed. It bounces, just missing Richard. Rachel crumples in a heap and begins to cry. The vibrator continues to buzz as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare branches against the winter sky drift past. Rachel looks out the passenger window. Richard stares ahead at t road. There is a very long silence.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (OS)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, you guys. Sadie is in back with the dogs.  116

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We’re the ones who should be sorry. For two people who want to be parents, we didn’t do a very good job of taking care of you.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) I’m supposed to be able to do that myself, aren’t I? A long beat of driving. You guys are gonna try again though, right? You’re not giving up? Richard and Rachel don’t answer, and Sadie’s question lin in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Subaru whizzes past and the camera whip pans to a hig sign that says: SARATOGA SPRINGS, NEXT 2 EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Slow down. It’s easy to miss... That’s it! Right there. Richard slows and signals. Out her window, Sadie sees TWO STONE GATEPOSTS flanking the entrance to a LONG, WOODED R On one of the posts is a sign that says YADDO.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: It looks like an insane asylum.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) Well, it is filled with crazy artists... Richard turns and drives through the gateposts. The snow covered woods sparkle like a winter wonderland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUBARU parks outside a STONE AND MARBLE MANSION that looks like a castle. Our trio and the dogs emerge, all slightly disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Richard accompany Sadie as she receives a tour JONATHAN, a male resident who leads them through the orna downstairs rooms, which appear both grand and gaudy.  117 Someone PLAYS PIANO, and the music drifts through the man The tour pauses in front of TWO FULL-LENGTH OIL PORTRAITS Katrina and Spencer Trask, the Wall Street baron and his who founded Yaddo.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: That’s them. Our patron saints. Spencer and Katrina Trask. (beat) They had awful luck with children.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: They couldn’t have them?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: No. They had four, but all of them died young. After the children were gone, they decided to turn their estate into a place for artists to come and work. (to Sadie) That’s why you’re here. LATER -- Jonathan leads everyone up a sweeping set of sta and down a passageway toward a door with inlaid stained glass. INT. KATRINA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS The group drifts in and looks around the beautiful, light filled space. Through the windows is a view of a TERRACED LAWN and a FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: This was Katrina’s room. Among the antique furnishings is a CHAISE LOUNGE. Look, you’ve even got your own fainting couch.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: Wait. This is my room? Jonathan smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Wow. I’ve been here three times and I never got this room. Sadie can barely contain her excitement, she sashays arou then fake faints onto the chaise lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Subaru, Sadie straps on her giant backpack.  118

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So we'll get you in a month, right?

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Actually, you don’t need to. Rachel and Richard look at her, confused. Sadie fesses up Sam said he could do it. Richard and Rachel are happy for Sadie, but a little hurt Sadie blushes. He’s always wanted to see Saratoga Springs and... I thought it would save you guys the trip. (to Rachel) Thanks, for whatever strings you had to pull to get me in here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I didn’t pull any strings.

dialogues.speaker: SADIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t put in a good word for me? I thought that’s why I got accepted. Rachel smiles and shakes her head, no. Sadie beams. INT. KATRINA’S ROOM - DAY Sadie pulls out her laptop and some notebooks, arranging the desk. She sits down, self-conscious but intoxicated b extravagant writing space. After a moment, she hears BARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard throws a ball for Eno and Lazlo, then joins Rache watch the dogs jump and play. It’s cold. We see their bre

dialogues.speaker: SADIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! Richard and Rachel look up to see Sadie, not unlike a pri in a castle, leaning out one of her windows. She waves an wave back. The three of them wave for a long time, then l their arms and just look at each other, unsure what’s nex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHILD'S FINGER presses a DOORBELL - BZZ2ZZ! The apartme door swings open to reveal Richard. He’s wearing a RUBBER MASK but it’s pushed up so you can see his face.  119 At the door are the same TWO KIDS from the earlier Hallow Scene: a GIRL (now 8) and BOY (now 11)

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Trick or treat!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You guys look great... what are you? The girl wears a strange outfit with a PLASTIC SEE-THROUG BUBBLE UMBRELLA, LEG WARMERS, BIG RUBBER BOOTS and a BATH SUIT under a DOWN VEST. The boy wears and Edvard Munch Scream Mask.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Climate Change. Richard nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: I’m The Scream. Who are you? Richard pulls down his mask. It’s Nixon. Richard does the standard impersonation, hunching over and making “peace” signs. The kids don’t have a clue.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Richard Nixon. (pushing the mask up) He was a president from when I was a kid. I wanted to wear my Bill Clinton, but I couldn’t find it. I guess he’s before your time, too. The children linger, then Richard remembers why they came Oh, yeah. He grabs a BOWL filled with CANDY. The KIDS take some, dr in their bags and say “Thank you.” As they walk away -- Sorry about the environment! The kids stop and look back. The girl nods in appreciatio before she and her brother continue on their way. INT. RACHEL AND RICHARD’S APARTMENT - DUSK Richard closes the door and turns to find Rachel wearing HILLARY CLINTON MASK.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey. Where’d you find it?  120

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (muffled) Linen closet. Rachel has also found Richard’s Bill Clinton mask, which holds out. For an odd moment, Nixon and Hillary stand the in silence, looking at each other. The familiar SOUND of MARCHING BAND filters into the apartment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NEIGHBORHOOD HALLOWEEN PARADE is in full swing: POLICEMEN hold traffic as costumed children march into TOMPKINS SQUARE PARK lead by the BAND OF PUNK PARENTS. An ORANGE CRAYOLA CRAYON DAD walks beside a BLOODIED MOM dressed up as Carrie. Children run around. Richard and Rachel, now both in their Clinton masks, walk with the revelers. Richard’s cellphone rings and he pushe his mask up to look at the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s the 800 number. They look at each other, paralyzed for a moment. Answer it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why me? Richard, flummoxed, doesn’t respond, so Rachel pushes her mask up and answers it. Hello? Uh-huh. Yeah. That’s us. (from their script) “No. We're happy you called. It’s the perfect time.” We’re just... out for Halloween. Rachel presses a finger into her ear to block out the par and steps away from the crowd. Richard watches her, and w hear pieces of her conversation. Yep. New York City. Uh-huh. Well, it’s got it’s pros and cons, but... What about you?... Oh, wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rental car whizzes past and the CAMERA WHIP PANS to a S Welcome to Virginia Virginia is for Lovers  121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard drives. Rachel cradles a folder in her lap. THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD -- an APPLEBEE’S comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Land, ho! EXT. APPLEBEE’S PARKING LOT - DAY Richard pulls in and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Rachel stare at the restaurant, then trade “h we go again” looks and climb out. INT. APPLEBEE’S - DAY A WAITRESS leads Richard and Rachel to a LARGE BOOTH wher sit down facing each other. The waitress hands them menus begins to clear two of the four place settings.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Actually... we’re expecting someone.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I’1ll grab another menu. The waitress leaves. They sit for a moment without speaki then Richard gets up and joins Rachel on her side of the

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: That’s better. Richard moves his water glass and place-mat over to his n seat. He takes Rachel’s hand and kisses it. She glances o and smiles nervously. They turn their attention toward th front door and sit there like that for a very long time, holding hands and waiting.
